alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Jennings (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 9:08AM EDT until May 25 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and southeast Indiana, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Jackson. In southeast Indiana, Jennings. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 AM EDT, Emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seymour, North Vernon, Brownstown, Vernon, Crothersville, Medora, Cortland, Hayden, Country Squire Lakes, Paris Crossing, Vallonia, Freetown, Kurtz, Pleasant View, Butlerville, Norman and Nebraska. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
